data.event: The Nora Stone, a Phoenician inscription found at Nora in 1773, has been dated by palaeographic methods to between the late 9th century and early 8th century BCE, and has been interpreted as referring to a Phoenician military victory and conquest of the area.

event.title: the conquest of Sardinia in 238 BC

data.event: After a period of domination by Carthage the town came under Roman control after the conquest of Sardinia in 238 BC.

event.title: went into decline from the 4th century AD

data.event: It went into decline from the 4th century AD and appears to have been abandoned during the 8th century.
